intro: Ceropegia albipilosa, commonly known as the ghost flower or white-haired fig, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and small, white, waxy flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has adapted to arid environments with its succulent leaves and ability to store water. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, such as moths. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental appeal and ease of care.
